body_html:
Yes, this is expected. Some operations on tensors like summing all numbers, taking their mean, max, min, indexing a 1D tensor will give you a Python number, while Variables will always repackage such number is a Variable. This will work:

a = torch.randn(5, 5)
b = a.sum()
c = a / b.unsqueeze(0).expand_as(a)
body_text:
Yes, this is expected. Some operations on tensors like summing all numbers, taking their mean, max, min, indexing a 1D tensor will give you a Python number, while Variables will always repackage such number is a Variable. This will work:
a = torch.randn(5, 5)
b = a.sum()
c = a / b.unsqueeze(0).expand_as(a)
body:
Yes, this is expected. Some operations on tensors like summing all numbers, taking their mean, max, min, indexing a 1D tensor will give you a Python number, while Variables will always repackage such number is a Variable. This will work:

```python
a = torch.randn(5, 5)
b = a.sum()
c = a / b.unsqueeze(0).expand_as(a)
```
